text: Career too shapes where we call 'home'.
the hustle becomes kinda comforting when it’s all linked to your grind and ambitions - like picking your neighborhood based on vibe more than convenience now
definitely agree - it’s those little familiar details that count now.
started tutoring in uni basics - pretty decent side cash.
not ideal but hey, gotta adapt right? making bank where you can beats struggling WINAPI
always double-checking building structures now even when just walking around
Had an odd job once where they splurged on ghost hunting gear for new building site—apparently hauntings aren’t great for business...
definitely seeing more diversity at job sites lately - both good progress for us.kode
academia’s slow but construction's shaking off old stereotypes too
more women in construction but still fight for equal respect
more women at site but mindset shifts slower than policy
lotsa spots here where being solo feels just right - no 'couples only' vibes.
solo gaming nights at cafes tho? unbeatable here
not sure those 'right' vibes last tbh, even some chill cafes turn into date night central after dark - marketing's slick like that huh? always read between lines for true color of any spot 😒
not everyone wants family-style setups; diverse options needed imo
noticed massive cultural shifts more than landscape changes tbh
